textBody: Hello there, Im Ashley Sands a -- year old programmer, currently based in {currentLocation}.
{currently}
Before starting my studies at Falmouth, I was a chef for roughly 15 years and acquired my NVQ Levels 1, 2 & 3 in catering at
Camborn Collage, Cornwall.

Mid way through completing my NVQ level 2 at Camborne, I found the joys of programing (roughly -- years ago). Back then i played a tiny parting in running a small (and to be honest, looking back, slightly dodge) shoutcast radio station.
Which inspired me to learn web development, with the aim to set up my own shoutcast radio station. Over the next couple of years I taught myself JavaScript and PHP (along with HTML and CSS).
Following that, i had a bit of timeout from programing, due to work commitments and also started DJing around town and filled a regular slot on
DirtyBass.FM.
The late nights DJing and early morning cooking, almost killed me, so i evenly packed in DJing and replaced with it with game development using
Unity (back in the 3.x days), and i haven't looked back since tho it was a couple of years before i decided i wanted career change and take my programing to the next level.
In 2018 i finaly made the leap and started studie Computing for Games at
Falmouth University.
To be honest, it was the best decision I've made in years, during my time there (so far) it has confirmed that programming is what I want to do with my life.
While at university we covered a number of subjects that go beyond the realms of video games, while keeping it relevant (to a games course).

Each year we have been tasked with making a game as part of multi-discipline team with 6+ members (Designers, Artis, Animators and Programers) which has a strong focus on scrum/lean agile techniques and version control (such as Git).

Along with servale personal projects which have covered a number of programming languages (C/C++, C#, Python), design patterns (Singletons, Observers and Factories etc...) and game engines / libraries (
Unity,
Unreal,
SDL and even
PyGame
Some of my favorite projects have included
<ul>

• Well Escape

    A 2d top-dow dungeon carwler made in PyGame

• Pancake Sim 2000

    A custum Ardiuno game controller and simple SDL game all about fliping pacakes

• PacMan-ish

    A PacMan like game made in Unreal with a focues on Behaviour Trees, Shaders, constum http server and UI layout

• SQLight Explorer

    SQLight Explorer was part of the pacMan-ish project, to view the leaderboard database remotly over http. The App was made using using Python and PyQt
• Multi-player RPG Game Server
